messages.message:
Hello! I'm seeing segmentation faults in all of the python services I run locally right now. I've restarted my computer and I'm on the latest master. Seems like it would be a problem with my environment rather than the codebase? Anyone have suggestions for things I can try to fix this?

Various error examples:
api-server: `start-local.sh: line 12: 20959 Segmentation fault: 11  flask gevent_server`
runner-service: `start-local.sh: line 2: 18878 Segmentation fault: 11  python server.py`
app-tasks: `start-celery-local.sh: line 6: 13822 Segmentation fault: 11  celery -A instabase.registry.tasks worker -l ${LOG_LEVEL} --concurrency=${NUM_EXECUTORS} -Q celery --without-gossip --without-mingle -n celery-app-tasks@%h --max-tasks-per-child ${MAX_TASKS_PER_CHILD} --max-memory-per-child ${MAX_MEMORY_PER_CHILD_KB} --task-events`
(I have more if needed)
I had this yesterday! Resolved by re-installing all the local python dependencies: `pip install -r tools/devtools/code-dependencies/python/requirements_py37.txt`

Yesss it worked thank you! The last thing I did before it happened was run `pip install -r requirements.txt`  in api-server-apps, so I wonder if a dependency there is out of date. I did also have to remove python-ldap from my requirements file to get the rest to install, if anyone else tries this in the future.
